title: 1990 Rallye Automobile Monte-Carlo
bio: Carlos Sainz signaled a new era by finishing a strong second behind Lancia’s Biasion, foreshadowing his rise to the top.

title: 1990 Swedish Rally
bio: The snow returned with intensity, but Toyota and Sainz proved their car could now win anywhere — even on Scandinavian ground.

title: 1990 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Toyota's durability dominated Africa again, with Sainz surviving the rocks and rivers of Kenya to earn crucial points.

title: 1990 Rally de Portugal
bio: Sainz took full control of the championship lead with a confident victory on Portugal’s gravel, building unstoppable momentum.

title: 1990 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Corsica's tight tarmac stages allowed Didier Auriol to showcase his smooth, efficient driving style in a perfect victory for Lancia.

title: 1990 Acropolis Rally (Greece)
bio: Dusty and brutal as ever, the Acropolis gave Sainz another strong finish and widened his title lead heading into summer.

title: 1990 1000 Lakes Rally (Finland)
bio: Sainz tamed the Flying Finns in their backyard, winning 1000 Lakes in a Toyota — a huge milestone for non-Scandinavian drivers.

title: 1990 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: A cautious finish was all Sainz needed to clinch the 1990 World Championship, marking Toyota’s first title in WRC history.

title: 1991 Rallye Automobile Monte-Carlo
bio: Juha Kankkunen struck first for Lancia in Monte Carlo, showing the Italian marque would not give Sainz an easy title defense.

title: 1991 Swedish Rally
bio: Sainz held strong in Sweden’s slippery forests, staying in the points while the Scandinavians dominated their home ground.

title: 1991 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Carlos Sainz took a massive win in the Safari, surviving one of the toughest routes of the decade in his Toyota Celica GT-Four.

title: 1991 Rally de Portugal
bio: Fast and dusty, Portugal rewarded consistency. Lancia responded strongly to Sainz's Safari success with a win by Didier Auriol.

title: 1991 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Auriol’s mastery of tarmac brought Lancia another win in Corsica, narrowing the gap to Toyota’s early championship lead.

title: 1991 Acropolis Rally (Greece)
bio: Sainz survived the rocks and heat of Greece to land on the podium, but it was Auriol’s Lancia that stood on top again.

title: 1991 1000 Lakes Rally (Finland)
bio: Kankkunen thrilled the Finnish crowds with a commanding win on home soil, tightening the title race heading into the finale.

title: 1991 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Sainz gave everything in Britain’s muddy forests, but Lancia sealed the manufacturers’ crown as Kankkunen clinched the driver title by just 10 points.

title: 1992 Rallye Automobile Monte-Carlo
bio: Didier Auriol opened the season with a classic tarmac win for Lancia, edging out rivals on Monte Carlo’s icy curves.

title: 1992 Swedish Rally
bio: Snow and ice favored local drivers, but Juha Kankkunen managed a strong finish that kept him in early title contention.

title: 1992 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Toyota’s Celica proved bulletproof once again in Africa, with Markku Alén taking victory in one of the toughest rallies on the planet.

title: 1992 Rally de Portugal
bio: Auriol claimed another victory for Lancia, putting pressure on Kankkunen while the Toyota-Lancia rivalry intensified.

title: 1992 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Tarmac titan Auriol made it three wins for the year on Corsica’s narrow roads, pushing Lancia toward yet another manufacturers’ title.

title: 1992 Acropolis Rally (Greece)
bio: The Greek rally punished every car except Kankkunen’s Lancia, as he clawed back points with a confident win.

title: 1992 1000 Lakes Rally (Finland)
bio: The Flying Finns ruled again, but this time it was Kankkunen who flew highest, delighting the home crowd and tightening the title race.

title: 1992 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Kankkunen sealed the deal on a fourth world title with a smart and steady drive through the wet British forests, giving Lancia its final WRC championship.

title: 1993 Rallye Automobile Monte-Carlo
bio: François Delecour took his first WRC win with Ford, proving the Escort RS Cosworth was ready to fight for podiums all year long.

title: 1993 Swedish Rally
bio: Juha Kankkunen started building his championship campaign with a smart win on Sweden’s snow-packed forest stages.

title: 1993 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Toyota swept Kenya once again with Ian Duncan leading a 1-2-3 finish, proving the Celica GT-Four’s reliability was unmatched.

title: 1993 Rally de Portugal
bio: Carlos Sainz took a much-needed win in Portugal, keeping Toyota’s hopes alive and showcasing his consistency.

title: 1993 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Corsica belonged to Delecour this year, as his precision on tarmac left rivals trailing on the island’s cliffside roads.

title: 1993 Acropolis Rally (Greece)
bio: The brutal Greek terrain tore through the field, but Kankkunen stayed cool and took another big win for Toyota.

title: 1993 1000 Lakes Rally (Finland)
bio: In a home rally masterclass, Kankkunen won 1000 Lakes and tightened his grip on the championship with pure high-speed perfection.

title: 1993 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Subaru’s Colin McRae stunned everyone by winning the RAC Rally in the Legacy RS — a star was born, and the world took notice.

title: 1994 Rallye Automobile Monte-Carlo
bio: François Delecour opened the season with a win for Ford, delivering flawless pace on tarmac in the Escort RS Cosworth.

title: 1994 Swedish Rally
bio: Sweden’s snow belonged to Tommi Mäkinen, who scored his first WRC win in a privateer Ford — the future Finnish icon was here.

title: 1994 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Juha Kankkunen triumphed in the toughest rally of the year, helping Toyota push ahead in the early championship battle.

title: 1994 Rally de Portugal
bio: Sainz gave Subaru’s Legacy a proper send-off with a dominant win, just before the arrival of the iconic Impreza 555.

title: 1994 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Auriol showed his tarmac mastery on Corsica’s winding roads, holding off strong drives from both Ford and Subaru.

title: 1994 Acropolis Rally (Greece)
bio: Brutal heat and rocks punished the field again; Auriol claimed victory and tightened his grip on the title fight.

title: 1994 Rally New Zealand
bio: Colin McRae claimed his **first WRC win**, mastering the flowing gravel roads and beginning his path to rally greatness.

title: 1994 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Didier Auriol sealed the drivers' title with a calm and calculated drive; Toyota capped the season as champions.

title: 1995 Rallye Automobile Monte-Carlo
bio: Carlos Sainz started strong with a win for Subaru, navigating snowy Monte Carlo with clinical precision in the Impreza 555.

title: 1995 Swedish Rally
bio: Kenneth Eriksson kept Subaru’s winning streak going on the frozen stages of Sweden, edging out the local specialists.

title: 1995 Rally de Portugal
bio: Colin McRae roared back with a victory in Portugal, showing that he wouldn’t let teammate Sainz run away with the title.

title: 1995 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Gilles Panizzi took his first WRC win, mastering the tarmac twists of Corsica and surprising the championship contenders.

title: 1995 Rally of New Zealand
bio: Carlos Sainz grabbed another crucial win in New Zealand’s flowing gravel stages, keeping his points lead intact.

title: 1995 Rally Australia
bio: McRae fought back again, claiming victory in Australia and setting up an epic winner-takes-all showdown at the RAC.

title: 1995 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Colin McRae delivered an emotional home win, clinching the WRC title in front of roaring British fans and forever cementing his legend.

title: 1996 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Patrick Bernardini surprised everyone with a privateer Ford Escort RS Cosworth win after a chaotic Monte Carlo opener.

title: 1996 Swedish Rally
bio: Tommi Mäkinen powered through the snow in his Mitsubishi Lancer Evo III, claiming his first win of the season.

title: 1996 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Subaru proved its toughness in Africa, with Colin McRae winning the Safari and gaining critical points.

title: 1996 Rally Indonesia
bio: In sweltering heat and tropical terrain, Mäkinen took a key win in Indonesia — his momentum building rapidly.

title: 1996 Rally Finland (1000 Lakes)
bio: The Flying Finns flew again — Mäkinen dominated his home event and took a giant leap toward the title.

title: 1996 Rally Australia
bio: Mäkinen clinched the title with another flawless victory on the fast and flowing Aussie gravel.

title: 1996 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Colin McRae gave the British fans something to cheer about with a victory in the final round — but Mäkinen had already sealed the title.

title: 1997 Rallye Monte-Carlo
bio: Piero Liatti took a surprise win for Subaru as the new Impreza WRC debuted with instant success on the icy roads of Monte Carlo.

title: 1997 Swedish Rally
bio: Kenneth Eriksson delivered a dominant snow win for Subaru, giving them a 2-for-2 start to the season under the new WRC rules.

title: 1997 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Tommi Mäkinen endured the harsh Kenyan roads to claim Mitsubishi’s first win of the year, jumpstarting his title defense.

title: 1997 Rally de Portugal
bio: Gilles Panizzi looked quick on the gravel, but Mäkinen’s consistency delivered another win and boosted his points total.

title: 1997 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Panizzi dominated on tarmac, giving Peugeot a boost and showcasing the future of France’s rally excellence.

title: 1997 Rally Finland (1000 Lakes)
bio: Mäkinen thrilled home fans with another high-speed win through the Finnish forests, keeping Mitsubishi in the championship lead.

title: 1997 Rally Australia
bio: In a pivotal late-season win, Mäkinen sealed the drivers' title for a second year in a row, mastering the flowing gravel stages.

title: 1997 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Colin McRae dominated the muddy UK finale in his Impreza WRC, but it was too late to stop Mäkinen’s back-to-back title win.

title: 1998 Rallye Monte Carlo
bio: Tommi Mäkinen opened his title defense with a precision win in Monte Carlo’s mixed snow and tarmac conditions.

title: 1998 Swedish Rally
bio: Mäkinen kept the pressure on with another dominant snow win, extending his early championship lead.

title: 1998 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Toyota proved their toughness with a win in Africa, and Carlos Sainz quietly kept his title campaign alive.

title: 1998 Rally Portugal
bio: Colin McRae won in Portugal for Subaru with a blistering drive, putting himself back into title contention.

title: 1998 Rally Argentina
bio: Mäkinen struck again on gravel, outpacing both Toyota and Subaru in the rough South American terrain.

title: 1998 1000 Lakes Rally (Finland)
bio: McRae delivered one of the drives of the year, flying through Finland’s jumps to win in front of Mäkinen’s home crowd.

title: 1998 Rallye Sanremo (Italy)
bio: Toyota's Didier Auriol showed tarmac brilliance with a dominant Sanremo victory, boosting Sainz’s title hopes.

title: 1998 RAC Rally (UK)
bio: Sainz was on track to win the championship… until his Toyota failed **just 500 meters from the finish**, handing Mäkinen his third straight title in heartbreaking fashion.

title: 1999 Rallye Monte Carlo
bio: Tommi Mäkinen edged out fierce competition on tarmac and ice to open the year with a win that set the tone for his fourth title run.

title: 1999 Swedish Rally
bio: Thomas Rådström gave Ford a much-needed snow win, holding off Subaru’s Richard Burns in slippery conditions.

title: 1999 Safari Rally (Kenya)
bio: Subaru’s Richard Burns took a major win in the African wilderness, proving his grit and endurance in brutal conditions.

title: 1999 Rally Portugal
bio: Colin McRae claimed Ford’s first big win with the Focus WRC, blasting through gravel in classic sideways fashion.

title: 1999 Tour de Corse (France)
bio: Gilles Panizzi stunned the field with a tarmac masterclass for Peugeot, setting the stage for the 206 WRC’s arrival.

title: 1999 Rally Argentina
bio: Subaru’s consistency paid off as Burns earned another strong finish, while Mäkinen hit problems and the title race tightened.

title: 1999 1000 Lakes Rally (Finland)
bio: Mäkinen thrilled the home crowd with a heroic win through the forests and jumps, regaining control of the points battle.

title: 1999 Rally GB (UK)
bio: Mäkinen sealed his **fourth consecutive WRC title** in the rainy Welsh forests, closing the decade as its greatest champion.
